document.title: Low Power Coding with Balanced Ternary for Communications using spread spectrum

abstract.name: Abstract
abstract.p: Coding with balanced ternary for communications using spread spectrum is proposed in this article. The proposed code with large number of codewords can achieve lower power cost than binary code. The proposed code with long spreading code even can achieve larger line rate than binary code.

section.title: 1Power Cost of Binary and Balanced Ternary

para.p:
According to Hartley, if transmitter has amplitude range
[
- A
, … ,
+ A
]
volts and the precision of the receiver is
⁢ Δ V
volts, the maximum number of distinguishable pulse levels
N
has relation represented as equation.

The amplitude of each symbol can be represented as
{
-
⁢ Δ V
,
+
⁢ Δ V
}
for binary and
{
-
⁢ 2 Δ V
, 0 ,
+
⁢ 2 Δ V
}
for balanced ternary. With power cost
P 2
of a binary symbol, power cost of ternary symbol is represented as
{
⁢ 4
P 2
, 0 ,
⁢ 4
P 2
}
. The power cost is different with the symbol in balanced ternary. Coding with less symbol
1
and
¯ 1
, the power cost of the code can be decreased.

I propose variable-length code in this article. Padding with
0
will convert it to fixed-length code. Communication is assumed to use spread spectrum. A single spreading code is used, and it is binary because
0
does not contribute to voltage level.

Code with minimum number of symbol
1
and
¯ 1
can be represented as
{ 1 ,
¯ 1
, 01 ,
⁢ 0
¯ 1
, 001 ,
⁢ 00
¯ 1
, 0001 ,
⁢ 000
¯ 1
, … }
. With spreading code
s
, the code is
{ s ,
¯ s
,
⁢ 0 s
,
⁢ 0
¯ s
,
⁢ 00 s
,
⁢ 00
¯ s
,
⁢ 000 s
,
⁢ 000
¯ s
, … }
. Each codeword can be send with the power cost of a single spreading code. Because
0
cannot be spreaded, time length of the symbol
0
can be shortened from the time length of the symbol
s
. In other words, the codeword consists of the sign of the spreading code and the period between the spreading code and the former spreading code.
In this section, I reveal the characteristics of the proposed code comparing to the binary code.

Each codeword appears in equal possibility. Equations uses

H
as the mean information content of the codewords.

figure.caption: Figure 2line rate ratio of the proposed code to the binary code

para.p: It is still unclear that the proposed code fits in Shannon-Hartley theorem. In Hartley’s law, information content of a pulse is logarithm of the number of distinguishable pulse levels. But in proposed code, information content depends on the number of distinguishable time period levels between pulses rather than pulse levels.

Coding with balanced ternary for communications using spread spectrum is proposed in this article. The proposed code with large number of codewords can achieve lower power cost than binary code. The proposed code with long spreading code even can achieve larger line rate than binary code.
